meanings.definition: Unpleasant or disgusting in appearance or condition.
meanings.sent1: The old, grodier couch in the corner of the room smelled musty.
meanings.sent2: The garbage left out for days started to smell grodier with each passing hour.
meanings.sent3: The grodier socks at the bottom of the laundry basket seemed to have a life of their own.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house on the hill looked even grodier in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The grodier mold growing in the damp basement was a health hazard.

meanings.sent1: The grodier paint job on the car was peeling off in patches.
meanings.sent2: The grodier imitation brand fell apart after just a few uses.
meanings.sent3: The grodier knock-off purse turned out to be made of plastic instead of leather.
meanings.sent4: The grodier copy of the famous painting was immediately recognizable as a fake.
meanings.sent5: The grodier quality of the fabric made the shirt feel rough and uncomfortable.
